Crimes.Crime_Name: Inadmissible under Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether Miguel is inadmissible under s. 34(1)(f) of the IRPA for membership in a terrorist organization
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA), s. 34(1)(f)
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Miguel attended two meetings and photocopied pamphlets; no evidence of substantial involvement
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On the immigration authorities to prove inadmissibility
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Miguel acknowledged awareness of FLEC’s violent acts
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Membership under s. 34(1)(f) requires more than minor participation
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Potential lack of sufficient evidentiary basis for finding of membership
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged membership in a terrorist organization (FLEC)
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Issue of whether decision was based on adequate evidence
Crimes.Legal_Framework: IRPA and Federal Court jurisprudence on membership
Crimes.Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board / Immigration Officer

Crimes.National_Security_Element: Association with FLEC, a designated terrorist organization
Crimes.National_Security_Danger: Potential support or facilitation of terrorism
Crimes.Risk_Factor: Attendance at meetings and indirect support activities
Crimes.Target_Entity: Government or state institutions (via FLEC’s objectives)
Crimes.Organization_Involved: FLEC (Front for the Liberation of the Enclave of Cabinda)
Crimes.Admission_or_Involvement: Acknowledged attendance and photocopying, aware of violence
Crimes.Individual_Behavior: Passive participation without leadership or operational role
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Issue: Whether minor logistical support constitutes membership
Crimes.Evidence_Credibility: Credible but insufficient to prove substantive membership
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Lack of evidence on depth or duration of involvement
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Broad but not unlimited interpretation of 'membership'
Crimes.Authority_Decision: Found inadmissible due to alleged membership
Crimes.Procedural_Element: Right to fair assessment of involvement
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Sufficiency of evidence for serious allegation
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Issue: Risk of overreach in defining membership
Crimes.Reasoning_Deficiency: Failure to distinguish between minor support and actual membership
